ud6.9:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ud6.9:1.3: Now at that time the Buddha was meditating in the open during the dark of night, while oil lamps were burning.
ud6.9:2.1: And many moths were falling down and crashing down into the lamps, coming to grief and ruin.
ud6.9:2.2: The Buddha saw the moths coming to grief.
ud6.9:3.1: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ud6.9:4.3: Like moths falling in the flame,
ud6.9:4.4: some have become fixed in what is seen or heard.”
